subject.normal: has anyone tried to run phobos on the google app engine ?

headers.subject: Re: has anyone tried to run phobos on the google app engine ?
headers.user-agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; en-US; rv:1.9.1b3pre) Gecko/20090223 Thunderbird/3.0b2

quote.quotepara: So does this mean we have to wait for Google to let more developers in, or can we hack on your account? :-) Laugh . .
+1 We hack Roberto account so we can test our stuff (me I want to test Atmosphere :-))
It works! I ran into two small, easy-to-fix issues.
I'll create new GAE-specific modules in phobos-svn, so we have more freedom to hack.
No worries: "Rhino works out of the box" (http://groups.google.com/group/google-appengine-java/web/will-it-play-in-app-engine)
I have a beta account on GAE. I'll try it over the weekend.
I wonder if we won't run into Rhino issues. The other scripting engines mentioned in the announcement, like JRuby, Groovy, Clojure, had to fix several problems.
To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@phobos.dev.java.net For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@phobos.dev.java.net
